intro: Microtatorchis podochiloides, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a small terrestrial orchid native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows on rocky substrates and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. The plant has slender, erect stems with few leaves and produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink. Its flowers are characterized by their intricate structure, typical of the Orchidaceae family. Microtatorchis podochiloides is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific habitat conditions for successful growth.
